reviews.text: I've been to this hotel several times for different conferences and love it every single time! The hotel location is great within the Cleveland Clinic and a short drive from downtown Cleveland and nice restaurants at little Italy and Cleveland heights. The hotel is very grand with granite everywhere and very well appointed, clean and spacious rooms. Only downside is that parking is valet only and the pillows are extremely soft to the point where you wake up with neck pain every morning. On the positive side, the separate shower and tub in the bathroom is great! The best part though is the main conference room. It is just the best for either a review course or CME meeting. It can get pretty "rough" in some areas not far from the hotel, so if you are not familiar with Cleveland, always check with concierge or take a taxi to where you are going before wandering around on your own. I've seen significant improvements around the city over the past few years and Cleveland does have many nice places and a recent modern and progressive vibe to it, especially the University circle area. If you are on a budget just try eating at the hospital cafeteria which is just a short walk across the skyway on the 3rd floor and opens until around 11:00 PM.

If you have reason to be at the Cleveland Clinic, then strictly for convenience sake, this is a good place to stay. Otherwise stay anywhere else in the Cleveland area and save yourself some money because you don't get anything special for it when you stay here.

reviews.text: We apparently were arriving just before a wedding reception. You've got to love that. The hotel seems to not have a separate entrance for large groups. I have stayed in hotels of all classes around the world and have never had to wait as long to simply have a parking attendant approach my car. We waited for about 15 minutes in a long line of cars before reaching the attendants. While waiting for the valets to park the wedding group cars, we saw valet after valet "race" the cars out of the drive toward the parking area. One of the car's wheels were actually squealing...I'm not kidding. I don't drive my car like that and I certainly don't expect someone else to. I couldn't wait to hand them the keys to my car!

reviews.text: The hotel lobby is a hotel lobby. There is nothing special about it. If you have done any traveling and stayed at hotels other than Days Inn and Motel 6, you won't notice anything good or bad about it. There is nothing wrong with it, but I just expected a little more from a hotel that is self described as a 4 1/2 star.
reviews.title: Loved InterContinental

reviews.text: The rooms are very clean, and the beds are very comforitable. Get the weekly rate if you are going to be there that long. It is cheaper then the Cleveland Clinic rate, and beats priceline, etc. We paid $135/night for a suite. The food is great from the menu in the dining room. The buffet was not so great. We ordered Vegetarian Pizza twice while we were there from room service and it is to die for. The best I've ever had. The TV sets are the old kind, not flats like you would think.
reviews.title: Best for Cleveland Clinic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went over to the other two hotels in the Cleveland Clinic campus, and The Guest House smelled bad and the rooms were nasty with the old cheap polyester bedspreads and crappy mattresses. The other Intercontinental Hotel and Convension Center was very upscale, and not really suitable for an extended stay. The cheapest room there is about $30 more than the suites, and its just a room.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, not very close to downtown

reviews.text: I don't usually sleep well in hotels, and I slept very well in the Suites. The walk to the Cancer center and the Heart center is short, and very safe. There are Cleveland Clinic police patrolling ALL the time. We never even got creaped out once. Note: If you have a computer, it costs $9.95 per day to hook up here.
reviews.title: Stay if you need to go to Cleveland Clinic and have the money as it is too expensive

reviews.text: In short, even the most discriminating person would be comforitable here. The service is exemplory, and the place smells clean, has a nice atmosphere, and is comforitable. The fitness center is small, and almost an afterthought. They have only one treadmill, one stairmaster type thing, and two static bikes. It has a weight bench, dumbells, two TV's, water, bathroom, towles, and fresh apples daily.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Very nice, upscale hotel located near the Cleveland Clinic. They gave us complimentary chocolates upon checking in. The room was gorgeous as well and was very comfortable and quiet. The bathroom had both a stand up shower as well as a soaking tub. The staff was friendly and informative when we asked for local dining recommendations. The internet service was provided by AT&T, so there is a charge unless you happen to have an account with AT&T (we did, so we did not have to pay).
reviews.title: extremely friendly, helpful, courteous

reviews.text: I stay here on many occasions and the location and service of the staff is suberb. Rooms are spacious and always very clean. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Cleveland.
reviews.title: Excellent as always

reviews.text: I attended a conference at the hotel. Both the conference facilities and the room accomodations were excellent and well-suited to the group. Some of us used the Skyway to get coffee at the Clinic in the morning. We were advised to not wander off the CC campus, We went to the Rock n Roll Hall of Fame via party bus one night; that was a treat. The hotel's bar had excellent tapas and cocktails and we ended our early evenings there.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Hard to Believe You are at Cleveland Clinic

reviews.title: Very Nice, clean and quiet
reviews.text: If you are looking for a clean and quiet hotel downtown, that is close to the Cleveland Clinic, and you want to pay $225 per night, then this is your place. Rooms are very nice and big. Nice hotel overall.

Stayed at the InterContinental for a conference at the Cleveland Clinic. As the previous reviewer noted, the rooms are quite nice, immaculate, have comfortable linens, minibar, coffee maker, etc. Bathroom was large with a separate tub and glass-enclosed shower, as well as a lighted make-up mirror and granite counters. For the most part, the staff, though, seemed oddly anxious.and detached. For example, I checked in with two colleagues. We each had specific room requests (minor things like bedding preferences) that were totally ignored. Everyone was perfectly polite, just weirdly nervous qnd disconnected. Maybe they were all just having a bad couple of days...
reviews.title: Nice hotel, odd staff

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel many times as I am a regular Cleveland Clinic patient. I always find the staff to be more than accommodating.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

description: The InterContinental Cleveland is situated on the campus of the prestigious Cleveland Clinic, less than two kilometres (one mile) from the University Circle cultural and arts district. Legacy Village shopping and entertainment, the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Progressive Field and the Historic Warehouse District are all within easy reach.
